question: Diagnosed with COPD, Emphysema, HBP, High cholesterol.  Episode in late September that was diagnosed as the first TIA (mini-stroke).  During exams a CTscan was done that was read a couple of times and discovered Laryngocele (both sides).  Surgery is being planned, once the cause of the now 12 TIAs is determined.   Another side effect and/or cause of the TIAs could possibly be Diabetes. (Doctors seem undecided to diagnose this, though doing all further exams as if has been diagnosed).  During 4th TIA, blood sugar measured 221.History: Had chronic exposure to Carbon Monoxide (9 months) several years ago.  Never truly recovered, never received any direct treatment for it.Question: Could the Laryngocele be causing the TIAs, because seem to be able to correlate the swelling of the neck to most instances of TIAs.Question: Could Diabetes or Brittle Diabetes be causing the TIAs, which in turn caused the Laryngocele?Question:  How can the pulsox monitor of oxygen in blood always appear high, when short of breath?
title: Laryngocele COPD-Emphysema and mini-strokes
